txt.en: 'Eorlingas, to me! Fear no darkness!'
'Farewell, Master Meriadoc... I go now to my fathers.'
Talk to Guthláf on the field of battle
'Even in... their mighty company... I will not now be ashamed...'
'It is forgiven. When you sit in peace... with your pipe... think of me!'
'But where is Éomer? He must be... king after me.'
Guard Théoden during his last moments
'And I would send... send word to Éowyn. She did not... want me to go...'
'Hail, King of the Mark! Ride now... to victory! Bid... Éowyn... farewell...'
Guard Théoden during his last moments
Guthláf is on the fields of the Pelennor, ready to ride as his king commands.
Éomer silently takes the banner from you and lifts it to the sky.
The battle rages before the White City.
'For glory and honour! Let us ride to Théoden King and make safe the fields before the city!'
DNT - Blah!
The Riders of Rohan have joined the battle, but on the fields of the Pelennor, great deeds go hand in hand with death.
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
Théoden nods at you weakly, desiring to speak

'I have come to the end... of my road... [placeholder]. But Rohan will go on...'

Théoden nods weakly.

'Pick up the banner... where it fell... and give it to Éomer. He must lead now...'
Ride with Guthláf and stand with the king
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'DNT - Blah!'
DNT - Blah!
Death has come to the Pelennor, and even kings cannot stand against it forever.
Death has come to the Pelennor, and even kings cannot stand against it forever.
'To the king!'
Théoden has come to the end of his road, but he has a final request of you.
Théoden requested that you pick up the banner of Rohan where it fell, and give it to Éomer.
Remain on guard as Éomer remembers the fallen.
'Mourn not overmuch! Mighty was the fallen, and so too was his ending!'
'We will weep when his mound is raised.'
'Death!'
'Gléowine! You will make a song of the dead, so they will never be forgotten!'
'Death! Deeeaaath!'
'How can this be? Éowyn?'
'Death comes to all!'
'Éowyn, how came you to be here? What devilry is this?'
'Deeeeeeeeeaaaaaattth!'
'Death, death, death! Death take us all!'
'Death! Death!'
'Death! Ride to ruin! Deeeaaath!'
'Théoden King...'
Théoden has asked you to give the banner to Éomer.
'Déorwine...'
Éowyn
'Éowyn I am, daughter of Éomund! You stand between me and my lord and kin.'
'Begone, if you be not deathless.'
'I will smite you if you touch him!'
'Begone, carrion-lord! Leave the dead in peace!'
'It is nothing to me. Still I will hinder you!'
'But no living man am I. You look upon a woman!'
Talk to Théoden
Pick up the fallen banner where it fell from Guthláf's hand
'Come not between the Nazgûl and his prey.'
Give the banner to Éomer, as Théoden requested
'You will know worse things than Death in the Chamber of the Eye!'
'Say you so? No living man may hinder me!'
Remain on guard
'Éowyn! Éowyn!'
'My lord...'
'Forgive me for breaking your command, my lord...'
'My lord... she is...'
Instance: Death Comes for All
